intro: Tarenna precidantenna, commonly known as the red-stemmed tarenna, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Madagascar and is characterized by its distinctive red stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a slightly pubescent surface. The flowers are usually white or pale yellow, with five petals and prominent stamens.
